name: A Movie, A Number, A Number Of Movies Multiple Choice Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: This 1961 Billy Wilder comedy featured James Cagney as a Coke executive. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
'One, Two, Three'.

	This was Cagney's last film appearance until 1981's 'Ragtime'.

questions.text: Albert Finney and Audrey Hepburn starred in this 1967 British film. What was it called?
questions.explanation:
'Two for the Road'.

	Directed by Stanley Donen, this film was about a bickering couple stopping to reminisce about their twelve years of marriage. Henry Mancini did the theme.

questions.text: This movie is about three silent film Western heroes who are summoned to Mexico for what they think will be a public appearance. What is it named?
questions.explanation:
'Three Amigos'.

	They find out that they were really supposed to rid a village of its bandit chieftain. Steve Martin, Chevy Chase and Martin Short starred in this 1986 John Landis comedy.

questions.text: What was the name of the 1995 compilation consisting of four short films set in an L.A. hotel on New Year's Eve?
questions.explanation:
'Four Rooms'.

	This not so well received film featured an all star cast, that included, Antonio Banderas, Tim Roth, Madonna, Quentin Tarantino and Marisa Tomei among others.

questions.text: What 'Five' film starred Jack Nicholson and Karen Black and was released in 1970?
questions.explanation:
'Five Easy Pieces'.

	This is the film with Jack's famous 'chicken salad sandwich' speech.

questions.text: In what movie does Will Smith portray a handsome con man who convinces well off, gullible New Yorkers that he is Sidney Poitier's son?
questions.explanation:
'Six Degrees of Separation'.

	Donald Sutherland, Stockard Channing and Ian McKellen also starred. Many New York City society types popped up in cameo roles.

questions.text: What 1954 Howard Keel and Jane Powell vehicle was later made into a television series and Broadway musical?
questions.explanation:
'Seven Brides for Seven Brothers'.

	In this musical, Keel's decision to get himself a wife, inspires his rowdy brothers to follow suit.

questions.text: What 1952 World War Two action film, focuses on a group of soldiers and the strain they undergo during continued enemy attack?
questions.explanation:
'Eight Iron Men'.

	Directed by Edward Dmytryk, it starred Lee Marvin and Richard Kiley.

questions.text: This Chris Columbus farce, featured Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Jeff Goldblum and Robin Williams. Released in 1995, what was it named?
questions.explanation:
'Nine Months'.

	A farcical tale of a couple, whose blissful five year relationship is blind sided by unexpected pregnancy.

questions.text: This 1971 British film is a presentation of the famous John Christie, Timothy Evans murder case that rocked Great Britain in the late 1940's. What is it called?
questions.explanation:
'Ten Rillington Place'.

	Outstanding performances by entire cast, which included, Richard Attenborough, Judy Geeson and John Hurt.
